pullRequest.title: #152 Use higher quality images for country flags
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description of the Change

All 218 currently supported country flags used as icons in Constellation have been updated with higher resolution versions.
Additionally a "flags" folder was added to the "icons" folder in the directory path "constellation\CoreVisual\release\modules\ext\icons" for ease of alteration and testing. FlagIconProvider.java was modified accordingly to reflect the directory location change of the flag images.
Alternate Designs

An alternate set was initially proposed as it had all 218 flags in a consistent style, from here https://github.com/gosquared/flags. While the flags were more accurate with better detail, the maximum resolution of the set was 64x64. It was advised that at that resolution the images would be upscaled and the improvement in quality would become negligible.
The current sets chosen contain flags which are 512x512 or greater which have been resized to 256x256, the maximum resolution currently supported by Constellation.
216/218 were sourced from here https://www.flaticon.com/packs/international-flags/2.
Guyana's flag was sourced from here https://www.flaticon.com/packs/flags-15.
A matching style and high resolution version for the New Caledonia flag was not found from the same site the other sets were found, so a 1280x640 image from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kanak_people was used.
Why Should This Be In Core?

More accurate depiction of country flags.
Benefits

Flags are more accurate and previously some flags had been replicated to compensate for missing flags, such as the reuse of the Liberia flag for the United States of America.
The flags are also more consistent now with the slight exception of the New Caledonia flag.
Possible Drawbacks

Higher resolution may now increase startup and load times of Constellation and graphs.
Verification Process

Functionality was verified by opening a new graph in Constellation and navigating to "Experimental" > "Build Graph" > "Sphere Graph Builder" and visually checking the whether the code and file changes were taking effect.
Applicable Issues

#152

commit.message: #152 Use higher quality images for country flags

nodes.bodyText: Thanks @sol695510, creating the flags folder was something I wanted to see done too. Nice 👍

commit.message: Added references to new flag assets
